page.title: 14RELIGION2 - NORTH TAWTON
page.content: {THE PARISH CHURCH OF ST.PETER. The building is partly{Early English and partly{Perpendicular}in style. {The nave}is the earliest part probably dating from the{12th. century}while the north and south aisles were added later,between{1340}and{1440.} {The Tower}which also probably dates from the{12th. century}is surmounted by an oak shingle truncated{spire.}The top of the spire was damaged by a fire which swept through the centre of North Tawton in{1834.} The effects of the{Civil War}can be seen;two statues are missing from their niches over the north door and southern wall of the tower and only small pieces of{early stained glass } remain in the north aisle windows. There is a{gallery}in the west end but the{screen}was removed in about{1740.} Small{vaults}exist beneath the church.
